meanings.definition: Remove the outer covering or layer from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully uncoated the gift to reveal the surprise inside.
meanings.sent2: The painter will uncoat the old layer of paint before applying a fresh coat.
meanings.sent3: The magician uncoated the box to show that the rabbit had disappeared.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rose, it seemed to uncoat the darkness of the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The chef uncoated the boiled egg, exposing the perfectly cooked yolk.

meanings.definition: The process of removing a coating or covering from something.
meanings.sent1: The uncoating of the car revealed its original shiny color.
meanings.sent2: During the renovation, the uncoating of the walls exposed the brick underneath.
meanings.sent3: The uncoating of the candy wrapper left sticky residue on his fingers.
meanings.sent4: The uncoating of the mystery novel's plot surprised the readers.
meanings.sent5: The uncoating of the onion made everyone in the kitchen tear up.
